job.title: Data Scientist - Operations Research
job.industry: Environmental Services,Information Technology and Services,Staffing and Recruiting
job.description: Mackin is looking for an Operations Research Scientist to work within a larger Analytics &amp; Technology-focused group to deliver innovative insights and solutions for our partners. The ideal candidate has a scientific mindset; has expertise in operations research methods and models; applies a pragmatic approach to building solutions; and enjoys collaborating within a dynamic, global team.<br><br><strong><u>Responsibilities<br></u></strong><ul><li>Apply your expertise in Operations Research, Data Science, and Data Mining to lead analytics projects to inform business operations in programs such as Transportation, Real Estate and Culinary</li><li>Build models related to shuttle planning, inventory control systems, capacity planning, and location analytics</li><li>Define, optimize and set the constraints for one or more business metrics<br></li></ul><strong><u>Minimum Qualifications<br></u></strong><ul><li>Degree in a quantitative field (e.g., Operations Research, Computer Science, Quantitative Finance) or equivalent experience</li><li>Experience in communicating model results to leadership and cross-functional team members</li><li>Familiarity with classical operations research problems, such as network optimization, facility location, routing, scheduling</li><li>Familiarity with algorithms and optimization using solvers such as CPLEX/Gurobi/Xpress or related tools</li><li>Strong foundation in statistics, probability, &amp; algorithms (e.g., hypothesis testing, regression, stochastic modeling, Markov Chains)</li><li>Proficient in SQL, including some experience with distributed data platforms such as Spark, Presto, Hive</li><li>At least 4 years of relevant experience (academic experience also considered)<br></li></ul><strong><u>Preferred Qualifications<br></u></strong><ul><li>Advanced degree in a quantitative field with experience in Operations Research</li></ul>
